page.title: 17RAILWAYS
page.content: {Ladybank has an open-air station with {a regular service to two main cities. {It has a modern signal system {controlled from Edinburgh.}These trains{run hourly.}We have a much{less {regular service to Perth with a single {line.}There used to be another line to Kinross which passed through many towns like ours. This line was closed. {Every Friday a privately owned train {comes into the sidings of the {junction.}It is called the{Royal {Scotsman.}The carriages can be hauled by steam or diesel. The station now employs only three people. The sheds, once busy, now only hold coal and rubbish. Although Ladybank workshops are dead the junction very quiet, {there are still 18 or 19 trains {stopping compared with the few {stopping when Ladybank was a major {junction.
